intro: Dimeresia, commonly known as the "Mexican candlewood," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. Dimeresia species typically grow in arid or semi-arid environments, exhibiting adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. Their foliage is often aromatic, and they play a role in supporting local pollinators and wildlife.
